Literature Review: The radical SAM enzyme superfamily is a vast and diverse group of enzymes that utilize a site-differentiated [4Fe-4S] cluster and S-adenosylmethionine (SAM) to initiate radical reactions. The mechanism of radical initiation in this superfamily has been the subject of extensive research, with a growing understanding of the common steps involved in the process. This review aims to summarize the current knowledge on the mechanism of radical initiation in the radical SAM enzyme superfamily, with a focus on the organometallic intermediate, Ω, and its role in the catalytic process.
